priority

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer priority
READWRITE: Get this process priority which is a number between 1 (highest priority) and 15 (lowest priority). Set this process priority

processDocument

public Document processDocument
READONLY: Gets the process document for this process. If the document is modified within the script the changes will be automatically saved by the Process Engine. If used to get the documents of process which is different from the process to which the current activity belongs the returned document will be read only and any attempt to modify it will throw exception. If used outside of the PE this API returns null.

If called outside of the current process (for example it is called for the parent of the current process) the method creates a new read-only document which is slow and memory consuming operation. In this case avoid calling this method several times in the script but call it once and assign the result to a local variable.

processInput

public CwObject processInput
READONLY: Input data object for this flow. Can be null. For executing flows returns data object passed as a parameter to "executeFlow" function

processOrder

public Order processOrder
READONLY: Gets the process order. May be null. If the returned value is string the order is locked Can be used only in the

processOrderId

public java.lang.Long processOrderId
READWRITE: Sets orderId (and hence the order object) for this process.

processOrderItem

public CwObject processOrderItem
READONLY: Gets the order item data for this process. Can be null. Order can have several sub-processes that are designated for specific order task or specific collection instance. ProcessOrderItem would specify where the process should look for order data that it is working on.

processOrderItemId

public java.lang.Long processOrderItemId
READWRITE: Order item data path ID for this process. Sets order item data path ID for this process.

processOutput

public CwObject processOutput
READWRITE: Output data object for this flow. Can be null. For executing flows returns data object that will be output from "executeFlow" function Sets output data object for this flow. After executing flows that will be output from "executeFlow" function

READONLY: Returns the process start time

Method Detail

cancelProcess

public static void cancelProcess(java.lang.Long procId)
Sends cancel signal (cancel exception) to a process. Process must be in an EXECUTING state.

Parameters:
procId - ID of a process to cancel.

cancelWorklistItem

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer cancelWorklistItem(Document wDoc,
                                                                   String reason)
Cancel worklist item.

Parameters:
wDoc - An instance of the system worklist document ("cwl_worklist:worklist") or document that extends it.
reason - Reason for cancellation (short text)
Returns:
0 - the item was not found; 1 - the item was deleted; 2 - the item was deleted and a taken task was created

changeProcess

public static void changeProcess(java.lang.Long procId)
Sends change signal (change exception) to a process. Process must be in an EXECUTING state.

Parameters:
procId - ID of a process to change.

createProcessForOrder

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object createProcessForOrder(Order order,
                                                                     String procMeta,
                                                                     String partMeta,
                                                                     String oper,
                                                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean wlflag)
Creates and starts a new user process with a given type for a given order. Performs worklist operations for a given user participant. If operation type is one-way (from process to user), this adds a worklist entry that is assigned to the current user. If the operation type is notification (from user to process), this sends a message to the newly created process.

Parameters:
order - Order object for this process.
procMeta - Fully qualified process metadata name.
partMeta - Fully qualified user participant metadata name.
oper - User participant operation to perform.
wlflag - flag indicates what value to return. Null or false will return process id and true will return worklist item
Returns:
Process ID of newly created process or worklist item id of the created user task or NULL if the participant operation is not a one-way operation or the method is called not from the browser UI environment.

createProcessUser

public static String createProcessUser(String processType)
Creates name from the process metadata type that can and used as user id. Created pseudo user id has '<' as a first character and '>' as last character. Created used id will be no longer than 32 characters.

Parameters:
processType - Fully qualified metadata name.
Returns:
pseudo user id.

createWorklistAction

public static CwObject createWorklistAction(String mpart,
                                            String oper,
                                            String user,
                                            Process proc,
                                            CwObject data,
                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean alertFlag)
Create worklist document for a participant, operation, user, process, and order item.

Parameters:
mpart - Participant name.
oper - Operation or Alert name. Operation name must be local to the provided participant or fully qualified name in format 'participant/operation' . Alert can be any alert name or description
user - User ID, null will create 'unassigned' item.
proc - Process object, can be null.
data - Order Item document object or Order object. If Order Item - set it as worklist's order item and set its top order as worklist's order If Order - set it as worklist's order while worklist's orderItem remains
alertFlag - if 'true' will create worklist alert where operation is set to the provided Alert description.
Returns:
Worklist document.

getActivityByIndex

public ProcessActivity getActivityByIndex(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer index)
Returns process activity for the given process activity index.

Parameters:
index - Process activity index. Activity index is the internal number assigned by the ConceptWave Process Management system and it guaranteed to remain the same only as long as metadata definition for this process (and for all sub-processes) remain unchanged.
Returns:
Process activity.

getActivityByPath

public ProcessActivity getActivityByPath(String path,
                                         String delimiter)
Returns process activity for the given process activity path.

Parameters:
path - Process activity path. Activity path consists of the names of all parent activities (ancestors) from the top process activity to the requested activity separated by delimiter character.
delimiter - The delimiter character. Of not specified or null the character '/' is used as delimiter. If the delimiter has more than one character the first one is used.
Returns:
Process activity.

getBucketNo

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getBucketNo(java.lang.Long procId)

getCachedOrder

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object getCachedOrder(String externalKey,
                                                              java.lang.Long orderId,
                                                              com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean readIfNotInTheCache,
                                                              com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean readOnly,
                                                              String externalKeyType)
Retrieves an Order object from the order cache for given internal or external key (If both id are given the cache will search first by internal and then, if not found, by external id). Automatically locks the order to the current user if the order is found in the cache and is not locked. The order will be refreshed if required, before it is returned. If the parameter readIfNotInTheCache is true and the order is not in the cache and the order id parameter is not null and is not 0 the order (if exists) will be read from the database, put in the cache, locked to the current user and returned. At least one of the external key and order id has to be specified.

Parameters:
externalKey - Object external key (may be null).
orderId - Order id of the top level order object (may be null or omitted).
readIfNotInTheCache - If true and the order is not in the cache it will be read from DB and put in the cache
readOnly - If true and the order is locked it will be returned in read-only mode. If the order is not locked it will not be locked to the current user. Currently not implemented.
externalKeyType - Type of the external key. Value of this parameter will be passed as a second parameter of the cwInit:cwExternalOrderIdCacheLoader global script if the order is not found by id and the cache does not know the correspondence between the external key and the order id (the External Order Id cache discarded the relationship or it was never loaded).
Returns:
Order object if the order is in the cache and is not locked or is locked by the current user. Order id if the order is in the cache but is locked by another user. Null if the order is not in the cache and, if readIfNotInTheCache parameter is true and the order id is specified, is not in the database too.

getDataObject

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object getDataObject(String ekey,
                                                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean lock,
                                                             java.lang.Long ikey)
Deprecated. As of 4.1 SP2. Use getCachedOrder method

Retrieves an Order object from the Order cache for given external key. If the order is found and is not locked by another user, it will be locked to prevent access by other users and returned. The order will be refreshed if required, before it is returned.

Parameters:
ekey - Object external key.
lock - For future use. Currently not used and may be omitted.
ikey - Internal key (order id) of the top level order object.
Returns:
Order object that represents top-level order for the given key or null if no object is found. If object is found in the Order cache but is locked by another user, the returned value is an order id that can be 0.

getOperationUser

public String getOperationUser(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer index)
Returns operation activity user for the given process activity index.

Parameters:
index - Process activity index. Activity index is the internal number assigned by the ConceptWave Process Management system and it guaranteed to remain the same only as long as metadata definition for this process (and for all sub-processes) remain unchanged.
Returns:
Operation activity user id or null if there is not user for this activity

getOrderFromCache

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object getOrderFromCache(String ekey,
                                                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean lock,
                                                                 java.lang.Long ikey)
Deprecated. As of 4.1 SP3. Use getCachedOrder method

Retrieves an Order object from the order cache for given internal or external key. If both id are given the cache will search first by internal and then (if not found) by external id. Automatically locks the order to the current user if the order is found in the cache and is not locked. The order will be refreshed if required, before it is returned.

Parameters:
ekey - Object external key (may be null).
lock - Optional parameter for future use.
ikey - Internal key (order id) of the top level order object (may be null).
Returns:
The order object if the order is in the cache and is not locked or is locked by the current user; the order id if the order is in the cache but is locked by another user. Null if the order is not in the cache.

getProcessDocument

public static Document getProcessDocument(java.lang.Long procId)
Retrieves the process document. If the API is called from script that does not run in in the activity of the specified process the returned document is read-only and any attempt to modify it will throw exception.

If the current process which contains the running activity is not the requested process (for example the process id id the id of the parent of the current process) the method creates a new read-only document which is slow and memory consuming operation. In this case avoid calling this method several times in the script but call it once and assign the result to a local variable.

Parameters:
procId - The process id
Returns:
Process document or null if the process does not exist or does not have document

getProcessInfo

public static Process getProcessInfo(java.lang.Long procId)
Gets the process object for given id. If the process runs on the current PE returns the current running process object. Note: If the process does not run on the current PE and the script change some of its parameters (for example priority) the changes will not be stored in the DB and will be lost after the script exits.

Parameters:
procId - Process ID.
Returns:
The process object that belong to this id.

isArchiveEnabled

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isArchiveEnabled()
Check if archiving is enabled

Returns:
True if archiving is enabled

isMemoryBased

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isMemoryBased()
Checks whether this process is memory based (i.e. does not save activity states)

Returns:
True if the process is memory based (i.e. does not save states)

isMemoryProcess

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isMemoryProcess()
Checks whether this process is memory based (i.e. does not save activity states)

Returns:
True if the process is memory based (i.e. does not save states)

performWorklistAction

public static void performWorklistAction(CwObject wDoc,
                                         Document mDoc,
                                         String operation,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean close,
                                         Order order,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object cObj)
Perform worklist action on a worklist item.

Parameters:
wDoc - Worklist item document.
mDoc - Not used. Pass null.
operation - Operation (action) name.
close - Not used. Pass false.
order - The order object
cObj - Confirm object

putDataObject

public static void putDataObject(String ekey,
                                 Order ord)
Deprecated. As of 4.1 SP2. Use putOrderInCache method.

Puts an Order object with given external key into the Order cache. If order with the given key exists in the Order cache, it will be replaced with given one.

Parameters:
ekey - Object external key.
ord - Order object that represents top level order.

putOrderInCache

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean putOrderInCache(String ekey,
                                                                Order ord)
Puts an Order object with optional external key into the Order cache. If order with the given key exists in the Order cache, it will be replaced with the given one unless it is locked by another user, in which case no changes are made in the cache. If the order does not exist it will be put in the cache and locked to the current user

Parameters:
ekey - Object external key.
ord - Order object that represents top level order.
Returns:
True if the order is put or replaced in the cache or false if it is locked by another user

releaseDataObject

public static void releaseDataObject(String ekey,
                                     java.lang.Long ikey,
                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean invalidate)
Deprecated. As of 4.1 SP2. Use releaseOrderInCache method.

Releases locked Order object(s) in the Order cache. Order object should be locked by current user (thread). Either external or internal key need to be provided. If both external and internal keys are null, all orders locked by current user (thread) will be released.

Parameters:
ekey - External key of the top level order object.
ikey - Internal key (order id) of the top level order object.
invalidate - Boolean flag. If true, released object(s) will be fully refreshed when accessed by future call to 'getDataObject' method.

releaseOrderInCache

public static void releaseOrderInCache(String ekey,
                                       java.lang.Long ikey,
                                       com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean invalidate,
                                       String externalKeyType)
Releases locked Order object(s) in the Order cache. Order object should be locked by current user (thread). Either external or internal key need to be provided. If both external and internal keys are null, all orders locked by current user (thread) will be released.

Parameters:
ekey - External key of the top level order object.
ikey - Internal key (order id) of the top level order object.
invalidate - Boolean flag. If true, released object(s) will be fully read from database when accessed by future call to 'getOrderFromCache' method.
externalKeyType - Type of the external key. Value of this parameter will be passed as a second parameter of the cwInit:cwExternalOrderIdCacheLoader global script if the order is not found by id and the cache does not know the correspondence between the external key and the order id (the External Order Id cache discarded the relationship or it was never loaded).

resumeAllProcesses

public static void resumeAllProcesses(java.lang.Long procId)
Resumes a process and its children. Process must be in a SUSPENDED or in an ERROR state.

Parameters:
procId - ID of the process to resume.

resumeAllStaleProcesses

public static void resumeAllStaleProcesses(java.lang.Long procId)
Resumes a process and its children even if they are stale . Process must be in a SUSPENDED or in an ERROR or Stale state.

Parameters:
procId - ID of the process to resume.

resumeFamily

public void resumeFamily(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer type)
Resumes the list of processes determined by the 'type' parameter. To resume, process must be in SUSPENDED or ERROR state.

Parameters:
type - Specifies processes to resume, possible vaules are: 0 - resume all immediate children 1 - resume all siblings 2 - resume all family (all processes belong to the same root process) 3 - resume all processes using same order

resumeProcess

public static void resumeProcess(java.lang.Long procId)
Resumes a process. Process must be in SUSPENDED or ERROR state.

Parameters:
procId - Process ID.

sendExceptionToFamily

                                  com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer type)

                                          String exception)

sendMessageToProcess

public static void sendMessageToProcess(java.lang.Long procId,
                                        String partType,
                                        String operation,
                                        CwObject message,
                                        Date mDate,
                                        com.conceptwave.scripting.Object dTime,
                                        com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer priority)
Sends message to a given user process. The message is written in the participant (CWPPARTICIPANT) table. To send a message to a manual participant (perform a worklist operation), the partType parameter should be the fully qualified metadata name of the manual participant, and the operation parameter should be the name of one of the notification type operations (from user to process) for this user participant.
For example: partType=namespaceName:participantName, operation=operationName

To send a message to an automated participant, the partType parameter should be null, and the operation parameter should be the fully qualified metadata name for the external interface operation.
For example: partType=null, operation=namespaceName:interfaceName/operationName

This function is useful for integrating ConceptWave Process Management product with external systems. External system can invoke ConceptWave API (that is implemented with JavaScript) that in turn can call the sendMessageToProcess function. This way external systems can send any messages to the processes.

Parameters:
procId - Process ID of the consumer process.
partType - Fully qualified user participant metadata name or null (for automated participants)
operation - Name of a user participant operation to perform, or fully qualified external interface operation (for automated participants)
message - Optional Document or DataStructure object that represents message data.
mDate - OptionalmMessage timestamp used for overriding the time that the message is put into the participant table which by default is the current time. Useful when external system sends confirmation messages in batches, but needs to specify each tasks completion time, that is known to that system.
dTime - Optional delay time. It can either be timestamp (java.util.Date) or an integer that specifies the relative delay in seconds from the current moment. Relative delay cannot exceed 6 months (190 days). Timestamp must be in future. If parameter is null or 0, then no delay is assumed.
priority - Optional message priority in the range from 0 to 15, where 1 is the highest priority and 15 is the lowest priority. If parameter value is 0 then default priority 8 is set. Value out of range causes exception.

sendMessageToQueue

public static void sendMessageToQueue(String processName,
                                      String operation,
                                      CwObject data,
                                      String messageGroupId,
                                      com.conceptwave.scripting.Object headers,
                                      String conversionMap,
                                      String callbackFunction,
                                      String msgCorrelationId,
                                      com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean mandatoryReqRespCallbackFunc,
                                      com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean returnErrorToCallback)
Sends message to a global process or interface process. The message is written in the participant (CWPPARTICIPANT) table.

Parameters:
processName - Fully qualified metadata name of global process or interface
operation - Operation to perform, should be one of the operations from interface supported by this global process or interface
data - Optional Document or DataStructure object that represents message data.
messageGroupId - Optional string that must have the same value for all messages that have to be processed on one and the same PE in the strict sequence of their arrival in the DB. An order id, customer number, etc. can be used for this purpose. If null or missing a random correlation id will be used and the message is not guaranteed to be processed in strict order and on the same PE compared to any immediately preceding or following message. As of 5.1.6, it has been renamed from correlationId.
headers - HTTP Clients: Data object (Document or Datastructure) whose immediate children/leaves will be used to set HTTP headers. SOAP Clients: List of data objects that MAY be used in conjunction with the metadata binding Input parameter "header" to generate soap headers. If no metadata parameter is specified, all data objects provided will be used as SOAP headers. If the "header" parameter is specified in metadata, only the first data object MAY be used to generate a SOAP header (Please see the metadata documentation for SOAP bindings for a description of the "header" parameter). The rest will be ignored.
conversionMap - Fully qualified name of the conversion map. If specified, then it will override the map specified in bindings.
callbackFunction - Optional, Fully qualified name of the callback javascript method. this method should be defined to take 2 parameters:response and msgCorrelationId, response could be a metadata object like datastructure or document.
msgCorrelationId - Optional, A string id used to link a response message with its request message.
returnErrorToCallback - Optional, A boolean flag. if true, any exception/error happened during interface calls would be passed to the callback function as the first parameter (response), which is wrapped as 'cwt_common:error' data structure. The callback function should have some extra check to handle this error data structure.

sendSignal

public static void sendSignal(String signal,
                              java.lang.Long targetProcessId,
                              String senderName,
                              java.lang.Long senderId)
Send signal to process.

Parameters:
signal - Fully qualified metadata name of the signal
targetProcessId - Target process ID.
senderName - Optional. Fully qualified process name of the sender object. If null or not specified the sender type information is not included in the signal
senderId - Optional. The id of the sender process. If not specifies or 0 the sender id will not be included in the signal

sendSignalFromProcess

public void sendSignalFromProcess(String signal,
                                  java.lang.Long pid)
Send signal from the current process (the process instance of the call) to the same or other process. The id and the type of the sender are included in the signal.

Parameters:
signal - Fully qualified metadata name of the signal
pid - Optional target Process ID. If not specified or less than or equal to 0 the signal is sent to the current process.

An order id, customer number, etc. can be used for this purpose. If null or missing a random correlation id will be used and the message is not guaranteed to be processed in strict order and on the same PE compared to any immediately preceding or following message. As of 5.1.6, it has been renamed from correlationId.

data - Optional order ID for this process or process document to use.
itemId - Optional order item ID for this process.
priority - Optional from 1..to.. 15. By default priority will be taken as defined in MD
Returns:
Process ID of newly created process.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the type name is not user process.

stopProcess

public static void stopProcess(java.lang.Long procId)
Sends stop signal (stop exception) to a process. Process must be in an EXECUTING state.

Parameters:
procId - ID of a process to stop.

suspendFamily

public void suspendFamily(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer type)
Suspends the list of processes determined by the 'type' parameter. To be suspended process must be in an EXECUTING state. When the process is suspended, it automatically suspends all its children (sub-processes).

Parameters:
type - Specifies processes to suspend, possible vaules are: 0 - suspends all immediate children 1 - suspnds all siblings 2 - suspends all family (all processes belong to the same root process) 3 - suspends all processes using same order

suspendProcess

public static void suspendProcess(java.lang.Long procId)
Suspends a process. Process must be in an EXECUTING state. When the process is suspended, it automatically suspends all its children (sub-processes).

Parameters:
procId - Process ID to suspend.

terminateProcess

public static void terminateProcess(java.lang.Long procId)
Terminates a process and all its children. The real moment of process termination is in the future, depending on whether or not the process is run by some active PE.

Parameters:
procId - Process ID.

updateProcessMilestone

public static void updateProcessMilestone(java.lang.Long procId,
                                          String code,
                                          Document doc,
                                          Date date)
Updates process milestone table for a given milestone code. If there is more than one milestone row for a given code (for this process), the latest inserted row will be updated. If both doc and endDate parameters are omitted or null, the END_TIME column of the specified milestone row will be updated with the current time.

Parameters:
procId - Process ID.
code - Milestone code (string).
doc - Optional Document object that contains custom data for the milestone table. The document should be either the system milestone document or should extend the system milestone document ("cwf:milestoneDoc"). If the specified document is not the system milestone document or extension of it an exception DE0322. Milestone table will be updated with every none-null attribute in the document.
date - Optional parameter that specifies value for END_TIME column in the milestone table.

updateWorklistItem

public static void updateWorklistItem(Document wDoc,
                                      Document oDoc)
Change worklist item priority, due date, or user.

Parameters:
wDoc - Worklist item document with changes to apply.
oDoc - Old worklist item document. Must be a copy of the old one, with same key.
